articles.author: Gram Slattery, Pesha Magid
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump will arrive in Saudi Arabia on Tuesday morning to kick off a four-day swing through the Gulf region, a trip that will focus more on economic deals than on the security crises besetting the region, from the war in Gaza to the threat of escalation over Iran's nuclear program.
articles.title: Trump starts Gulf visit seeking big economic deals

articles.author: Phil Stewart, Idrees Ali, Humeyra Pamuk, Erin Banco
articles.description: Days before a surprise U.S. ceasefire agreement with Houthis, U.S. intelligence started picking up indications the Yemeni fighters were looking for an exit after seven weeks of relentless U.S. bombings, four U.S. officials said.
articles.title: Exclusive: Houthi ceasefire followed US intel showing militants sought off-ramp

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. and European diplomats went on a flurry of calls in the hours after U.S. President Donald Trump offered on Monday to join prospective Ukraine-Russia talks later this week, trying to find a path that would bring an end to the war in Ukraine.
articles.title: Rush of diplomatic calls follow Trump's offer to join potential Russia-Ukraine talks

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Hatem Khaled
articles.description: An Israeli airstrike on the Gaza Strip on Tuesday killed a well-known Palestinian journalist who it accused of working with Hamas and was recovering in hospital from an earlier strike, the territory's health ministry said.
articles.title: Israeli strike on Gaza hospital kills wounded journalist

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A federal judge in Pennsylvania has ruled the United States can use the 1798 Alien Enemies Act to fast-track the deportation of accused Venezuelan gang members in the state's western district, but must give them at least 21 days' notice and the opportunity to challenge their removals.
articles.title: US judge says Trump can use Alien Enemies Act for deportations

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The de minimis exemption, for items valued at up to $800 and sent from China via postal services, were previously able to enter the United States duty free and with minimal inspections.
articles.title: US to cut 'de minimis' tariff on China shipments, bolsters broader trade truce

articles.author: Daren Butler, Jonathan Spicer
articles.description: Turkey is embarking on a hazardous path to ensure the Kurdistan Workers Party (PKK) militant group implements its decision to disband after 40 years of conflict, facing obstacles that need to be overcome in neighbouring Iraq and Syria.
articles.title: Turkey and PKK face a tricky path determining how militants will disband

articles.author: Promit Mukherjee, David Ljunggren
articles.description: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney, who won an election last month promising to stand up to U.S. President Donald Trump, unveiled a new cabinet on Tuesday that he said would help define a new relationship with the United States.
articles.title: Carney unveils cabinet aimed at resetting US-Canada ties

articles.author: Marcelo Teixeira
articles.description: Brazilian microbiologist Mariangela Hungria, whose research has helped farmers in the country sharply boost grain production, has been named the 2025 World Food Prize Laureate, the Iowa-based foundation organizing the prize said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Brazilian researcher who helped country's grain boom wins World Food Prize

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Tuesday he would order the lifting of sanctions on Syria at the behest of Saudi Arabia's crown prince, in a huge boost for interim Syrian President Ahmed al-Sharaa as he seeks to stabilise a country shattered by war.
articles.title: Trump says he will remove US sanctions on Syria
